Still, unlike Mnuchin and Ross, Palin and Carson have something in common with the voters who believed Trump would be a champion of the common man: They do not let facts get in the way of naive belief.
Palin and Carson would both be more unusual choices, if only for the fact that they lack qualifications for any of the possible openings.
Former vice presidential candidate and Tina Fey impersonator Sarah Palin is on the list of possible Cabinet appointments.
So is neurosurgeon and somnolent presidential candidate Ben Carson .
